alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 11:41AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Randall, southeastern Deaf Smith and south central Potter Counties through 1215 PM CDT... At 1141 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northeast of Hereford, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Hereford, Canyon, Mescalero Park, Buffalo Lake, Bushland, Dawn, and Umbarger. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
